object.name: InlineQueryResultLocation
object.description:
Represents a location on a map. By default, the location will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the location.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.
object.html_description:
Represents a location on a map. By default, the location will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the location.

Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.
object.rst_description:
Represents a location on a map. By default, the location will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use *input_message_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the location.
**Note:** This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

annotations.description: Type of the result, must be location
annotations.rst_description: Type of the result, must be *location*
annotations.name: type

annotations.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes
annotations.name: id

annotations.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500
annotations.html_description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500
annotations.name: horizontal_accuracy

annotations.description: Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.
annotations.name: live_period

annotations.description: For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.
annotations.html_description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.
annotations.name: heading

annotations.description: For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.
annotations.html_description: Optional. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.
annotations.name: proximity_alert_radius

annotations.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message
annotations.name: reply_markup

annotations.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the location
annotations.html_description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the location
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the location
annotations.name: input_message_content

annotations.description: Url of the thumbnail for the result
annotations.html_description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Url of the thumbnail for the result
annotations.name: thumbnail_url
